title: Flu jab
body: Went for my flu jab on Dec 12th along with lots of others. Very well organized, no waiting and very quick. Hoping that the Covid Vaccine when available will be done in the same manner.

title: Fantastic Doctor
body: My father and I visited the doctor this morning. He was just outstanding!! He dealt with my Dads problems with sympathy, patience and expertise. We were so impressed, he was so kind and compassionate, and absolutely fantastic Doctor.

title: Horrendous GP and disgusting waiting times
body: One particular doctor in this practice is an absolute joke - always well over an hour waiting time even for children. Last time we saw her she was extremely rude to my 5 year old and we‚Äôve just walked out of there after being told they are running over an hour and a half behind - this could have something to do with the fact that she seems to sit in her consultation room for 10 minutes between patients as we have observed on several occasions. All the other doctors there run fairly on time - this is a serious issue that should be addressed.

title: Awful receptionist
body:
I had to wait 40 minutes to speak to someone and the lady was extremely rude, continually interupting me and telling me‚Äùi wasn‚Äôt listening‚Äù I asked for her name and she hung up on me without offering me any help- I will be looking to see if there is a recording of the phone call and escalate this as it‚Äôs completely unacceptable. I  am
now recalling and am 16th in
the queue. This customer service is absolutely terrible

title: Great practice
body: I was contacted to arrange flu jab, it was all very easy online. Whole procedure was quick and easy and pain free üòÄ

title: Well cared for
body: I fell and broke my wrist. Within 3 hoursi was given painkillers, xrayed, treated and plastered. Every person i met was caring, efficient, and yet professional. The back up has been just just as good. I was even allowed to choose the colour of my plaster - i chose a very bright pink!

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Flu vaccine experience
body: Went for a flu vaccine at the Goldsworth Park Health centre. They were organised, efficient and had put social distancing measures in place to keep visitors safe. I was sent a text informing me to only arrive 5 mintutes before the appointment which was helpful. I had to wait to be called into the centre and then only waited a couple of minutes in the waiting room, the chairs were very spaced out so I felt safe. The nurse that administered the vaccine was polite and friendly and talked me through what she was doing. She also noticed that I had a cut on my thumb and applied a plaster which I thought was very kind. The waiting time appointment didn‚Äôt last very long at all which I appreciated. Overall I was very happy with the experience.

title: Amazing care, support and kindness.
body: I came in for a hip replacement on the 16th November. During my stay every single person on Delamare ward and the surgical team were absolutely amazing. The care, kindness and support that they gave me was second to none and I was actually quite sad to leave! A huge ‚Äò Thank You‚Äô to everyone involved, I am in absolute awe of you all.

author: Gam1233
title: Admissions haven‚Äôt been so great
body:
I have been admitted several times this year due to self harm. My treatment is almost always excellent however last few admissions haven‚Äôt been so great.  
The treatment is always explained and the same, two iv infusions the first over 2 hours and the second over 10 hours with no gap in between. My last couple of admissions this hasn‚Äôt happened there has been gaps in treatment for example there was an 1hr 45 min gap between the first and second infusions this resulted in the nurse adjusting the time on the pump to 8 hr 15 min rather than 10 to cover up the gap. Surely that shouldn‚Äôt happen and the treatment is so specific for a reason, I feel due to the reason I was in I get treated very differently

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: couragetd47
title: The best nurses in Stirling!
body:
I recently attended the Dermatology Clinic at Stirling Community Hospital and it has to be the best appointment I've ever attended in my 84 years.  
I was taken into the care of David and Angela who were amazing. They made me feel so relaxed and took care of me from entering until I left. These individuals with their friendly yet very professional approach should be used a blue print when training other staff in dealing with patients. They remain so upbeat and cheery while doing a very stressful job day after day.  
I cannot thank them enough, they deserve all the praise possible.

author: papacs88
title: I was hugely reassured by staff.
body:
I suddenly experienced mild stroke-like symptoms and following a call to NHS24 and assessment by paramedics/ambulance crew, was admitted to Crosshouse Hospital, Kilmarnock. Following a full interview explaining and discussing my test results, I was discharged around 4pm the following day, with a comprehensive information pack and with further outpatient appointments to be arranged.  
Recognising my symptoms I was feeling extremely anxious, but from the prompt arrival of the ambulance and throughout my time in the hospital, I was impressed by the comprehensive process of assessment, treatment and diagnosis. Just as important, I was hugely reassured by staff at all levels, who while carrying out their roles purposefully, kept me informed, responded to my questions, and showed empathy at all times.  
Over and above the expertise employed to establish a diagnosis and course of treatment, the care and consideration provided to me stands out and I wish to express my gratitude and sincere thanks to all staff involved.

title: Covid-19 Vaccine
body: My mum had her first covid vaccine today. Really well communicated, and we‚Äôll organised when we got to Deakin House. Such lovely, friendly, reassuring staff. Thank you

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care
body: I went with my son to the A&E after being referred from a different hospital. The two nurses and the doctor that took care of my son were not only very professional and knowledgeable but also extremely kind and helpful. I just want to say THANK YOU

title: Impressive
body: Was invited for over-50 flu jab by SMS. Booking was easy with appointment on Saturday morning. Efficient queue management and treatment. Was done in no time. Also received some preliminary advice regarding covid vaccination. Very impressive work by the practice.

title: Excellent care
body: I recently attended with my 1 year old Son for his routine vaccinations. We were seen promptly and the nurse was very professional and instilled confidence.  I find the reception team are always helpful and have found the practice has adapted well to provide safe care during the pandemic. Thanks to all of the team at Berkeley Place Surgery - you‚Äôre doing a great job in these difficult times.

title: Good service
body: Very friendly and good customer service. Can‚Äôt find any fault. Doctors are caring and always go the extra mile to help you. Reception help with any advice you need. I always get apppintment when I need and the email is quick and easy. I love it. Well done everyone

title: Perfectly looked after
body: I would like to say a BIG  thank you to all the team that looked after me today.  No awkwardness,  well cared for and covid secure.  Team were rushed off their feet but did bot impede their care of patients.  Thank you and well done.  üëèüëèüëè

title: She called me to make sure everything was well
body: Five star service from this surgery which always prioritised my health. Today i received a call from the manager who wanted to check I had been to my urgent two weeks appointment. Everything went smoothly.  It was very caring and genuine concern. May the NHS always be protected especially the angels which work in it ! Thank you so much

title: Best GP practice I have ever experienced
body: No long waiting times, reception staff are so friendly, efficient yet give you confidence they are doing the right thing. I have so many helpful specialist referral when I have needed it balanced with reassurance when no further action is necessary. Best GP surgery I have ever experienced

title: 3rd times the charm!
body: For the past 3 years, each November I have a lump pop up in an area where you do not want a lump. Each time I have been referred and each time I have gone to the Jasmine Centre at DRI. On each occasion I have been treated professionally, with care and empathy. The receptionist, nurses, healthcare assistants, consultant and finally the ultrasound / lump removal ladies all treated me with exceptional care and kept me informed every step of the way. The only difference this time round was less people in the waiting room. Thank you all for your help and care.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Colorectal Surgery
body: I had a fantastic experience undergoing my first portion of colorectal surgery at UCLH. The doctors and consultants were all extremely thorough, and in being so, completely put my mind at ease. The nurses were all very helpful and gracious during my time recovering on the ward. I highly recommend UCLH for anyone needing to undergo a surgical prodecure.

title: A very professional and friendly practice
Excellent Practice
body: I have always thought this practice is excellent and now with Coronavirus they are even excelling there own great standards!   The reception staff are friendly and efficient. I‚Äôm always surprised how easy it is to make an appointment and the doctors are thorough and compassionate.  Really feel so lucky to be local to this surgery. Keep up the great work we know it‚Äôs been a hard year for everyone.  Have a great Christmas too!!!

title: Incredible care, expertise and service
body: Our daughter has only just turned 2 years old and hasn't been able to walk due to inflexibility in her lower leg on her right side. We had seeked treatment privately but the insurer wouldn't cover our care. We met with the staff in your plaster room on the advice our one of your superb consultants. The care we received was exceptional from the plaster room manager and his assistant. In only 2 weeks our daughter is able to walk properly due to their outstanding treatment, care and empathy. World class service on a local level. We are so very grateful!

title: Prompt service
body: I needed antibiotics so rang the surgery and they arranged for someone to ring me back. They contacted me within an hour and everything sorted. No trouble in getting through, even on a Monday morning.  Thank you everyone for your understanding and prompt efficiency.

title: Best ever
body: I have been a patient for 15 years and apart from one occasion ( the doctor has now left ) have had nothing but the best treatment from all and I mean all of the staff. During this pandemic I have had my prescriptions , the flu jab , the occasional phone call from the nurses and girls on reception. Knowing what sort of people work at Marybone I am sure they have given this sort of care to lots of others and not just me.

title: Very good and prompt service
body: I was able to get advice, support and assistance whilst elsewhere in Europe plus all relevant test paperwork was emailed to me for my return to uk

author: julyrb75
title: An apology letter is not enough
body:
My brother had a serious accident with life changing injuries in February 2018 and was admitted to the royal infirmary Edinburgh. I feel that his treatment has been nothing short of disgusting.  
He has 3 shattered limbs which were operated on with little or NO follow up resulting in other injuries and more surgery to come. As a result of his accident he has a diagnosis of complex PTSD, this was made worse by his treatment while in hospital. I have witnessed some awful, callous treatment by front line staff. Staff should all be trauma informed but NONE that I encountered seemed to care at all.  
After 2 years of my brother desperately trying to get medical staff to listen to him he received X-rays and a scan where it was discovered he still has broken bones and the steel rods and screws had all moved causing pain and injuries to his other leg. As his sister it makes me so angry to witness how hard he tries and how he has been treated by the NHS. He‚Äôs received an apology by letter for some of his treatment, but this is not enough.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Impossible to contact
body:
It is impossible to contact them. I have been trying to contact them for over 2 hours this afternoon.
Initially the phone was constantly busy and I got immediately disconnected every time I dialled (40+ times). Then I managed to get on the queue 3 times and I kept holding and listening to music 20-25 each time just to get disconnected at the end. On one occasion I was first on the queue for 15min but I could not get through to anyone and the call was disconnected again.
I am currently holding and waiting to connect for a 4th time but I actually expect to get disconnected other 20min down the line or  because there is another person waiting to connect as well. They just disconnected me for a 4th time in a row. Appalling service.

title: Very professional.
body: Very well planned out, social distancing in place, hand sanitizer in several places, amazing. Staff very cheerful and pleasant even though it was a walk in centre appointment, staff made me feel safe and welcome. Well done to everyone for their kindness.

title: Flu Jap
body: Very good in and out In under 5 minutes very professional temperature taken on arrival confirm name and date of birth walk to the nurse injection and out again easy

title: Extremely thankful
body: I was admitted to the Cumberland Infirmary on the 6 of April whenI was diagnosed with necrosis fascists I had 5 operations to rectify this and have a long recovery ahead of me I would like to thank everyone involved with my diagnosis and recovery and I would like to say a massive shout out to all the excellent care and help l had on hazel ward you we're all fantastic

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic flu clinic for 50+
body: The flu clinic, which was extended this year to include patients aged 50 and over, was a very slick operation. Quick and efficient, no queues. Well done to the team at Lingfield Surgery!

title: Excellent practice
body: Excellent care  when i visit the maples from reception to see a doctor all staff very polite and friendly

title: Bad practice
body: Told by receptionists you must book same day appointments from 8am. When you ring at exactly that time and continue to do so for over 100 times you finally manage to get through to be put on hold for over 14 minutes and when they do answer your told there are no appointments left. Shocking system and service.

title: Brilliant
body: It was quick and very professional I didn‚Äôt have time to worry about the needle! It was all over before I knew it.

author: Trickydicky197
title: Staff were superb and professional.
body:
Dialed 999 early morning stating I believed I was suffering from heart failure but the ambulance took at least 40 minutes to arrive from their station about 10 minutes drive away from me in Sheffield.  
Once they arrived excellent service and taken to Sheffield Northern General Hospital where I was assessed and taken to a ward to await the fitting of a pacemaker. Very well monitored a had implant fitted about 4pm. I was discharged at 2pm the next day. I can only say that all the departments and staff were superb and professional. I came away feeling so proud of our NHS.  
Very disappointed with the 4 times failure to send my response to text message I received.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Superb podiatry
body: I have been completely blown away by the speed of this department. Not only were they able to provide me with a very quick appointment but the turn around for my new orthotics was incredible - just 2 weeks. My podiatrist was so professional, friendly, approachable and of course knowledgeable. From a covid point of view, I felt very safe and would definitely recommend her to anyone. Thank you so very much.

author: indiahm63
title: My wonderful rheumatology nurse
body: Whenever I‚Äôm in touch with Maureen at Gartnavel hospital she always makes me feel better, no matter how much pain I‚Äôm in.   She is an unsung hero.

title: Awful awful surgery
body: Receptionists need training. They are rude, insensitive and lack patience and sympathy/compassion. They always sound like they don‚Äôt want to work or be there. They rush you off the phone if you‚Äôre calling for results or to enquire. Such a big shame that the receptionists let down the surgery since doctors can are much better at providing services

author: Ambxy46
title: Assessment Unit
body: EPAU left me to bleed without even checking that everything was ok... 3rd pregnancy they have done this, it's an absolute joke! I have to sit and just hope for the best because I haven't been checked or sent for bloods!

readBy.name: Blackpool Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Lexiea
title: Covid test hub
body: I am a member of staff who attended for a Covid test after spiking a temp at work. The ladies on shift that day were just amazing. I had a little wobble before having the test as my husband is on the shielding list and for the fact I had been working when I spiked the temp. They were just lovely and the actual test itself was not as bad as I had imagined as they talked me through it and made me feel comfortable. When your confined in a ward setting you do not actually realise how busy the staff are in the covid hub and the number of people they test. I totally take my hat off to the staff running this service and would like recognition for their services.

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Nadministration
title: Diagnostic Procedure
body: Apprehension at procedure (colonoscopy) quickly put at ease through attentive, caring and professional service

readBy.name: Office of Colin Smyth, MSP for South Scotland

author: Col2020
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: A video meeting organised for my mummy
body: My mummy was admitted to craigavon area hospital on Friday following a slip at home.. as there is no visiting with covid a lovely lady Sylvia set up a video call for us at 4 today with the help of Dominic. We are so grateful to them both as it was great to see mummy. Thank you so so much. X

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Tashi Deleg
title: My GP Practice
body:
I have been in very regular contact with my GP at Pathhead Medical Practice for some time now regarding physical issues with my health.  
At each and every interaction with Dr Green over the years, she has demonstrated her commitment to providing the highest standard of care, whilst ensuring the principles of professionalism and integrity in her role as a GP.  
Dr Green has helped me through situations I have found difficult and challenging at times, and her compassionate and caring nature shone through at each and every turn, without fail. She has made such a difference to my healthcare journey, and her actions have very much supported me to help improve my own health in return; she treats patient as a whole and holistically, rather than just viewing symptoms individually.  
The Reception Staff have also, on each and every occasion, been very helpful, and their communications excellent. They are a great team, and I am extremely grateful to them all.  
Thank you simply isn't enough for Dr Green and the Reception staff at Pathhead Medical Practice. I hope NHS Lothian recognise the efforts from the Practice, as in my opinion they most certainly set an example other services would do well to learn from, and follow.

author: scorpiusmc55
title: Very understanding and reassuring.
body:
I went to see the Consultant Colposcopy (Miss. Harper) recently for a a lump I have noted for few weeks. I was overwhelmed to see 4 people in the room. However, the consultant Dr Harper has been very understanding and there was a registrar there and she decided she would not join the examination as I was really nervous about it and didn't like many people staring at me, at least I didn't feel comfortable. The two nurses were their to comfort me. At the end of the examination Dr Harper took her time to explain exactly what my problem was, she jotted it all down on a piece of paper, as I have explained that I am into research and she understood that I would want to read about the procedure she will have to carry out on me in the next coming few weeks.  
She has been lovely and reassuring, and I was satisfied by the service and how she has dealt with someone who was worried, specially that I arrived there alone to find 4 people in a room which wasn't expected.

author: SophM20
title: Exceptional care and professionalism
body:
I was admitted to Ravenscraig late September suffering from severe depression.  
I was dangerously underweight, was uncooperative and had no interest in anything or anyone including my family.  
However, 9 weeks later thanks to the exceptional care and professionalism of the staff in Ravenscraig and also sessions of ECT, on the day before my discharge I took a dance class with both staff and patients!  
During my stay I had my hair cut and styled which boosted by confidence and self esteem and enjoyed chats with members of staff and fellow patients.  
Happily I am now back to my normal self, able to enjoy my family and life in general.  
I would like to express my heartfelt gratitude to all at Ravenscraig.

author: capellatq38
title: The magnificent people who care for us and keep us safe.
body:
I recently telephoned my G. P. Practice in Montrose - Townhead Practice at Links Health Centre, Montrose, as I had a swelling below my left lower jaw and a very sore throat. Consequently, I was finding eating, swallowing & speaking more and more difficult. My G. P. conducted a telephone consultation about 1 hour later, and agreed that a face to face consultation was appropriate/necessary. Following a detailed discussion/examination and two telephone calls to on-call doctors at Ninewells, it was agreed that I should attend Ninewells, Oral and Maxillofacial Department for further investigations.  
I travelled straight to Ninewells, and, that afternoon, went through thorough investigations, which concluded that I had two areas of infection linked to a dental abcess. I was admitted to Ward 7 that afternoon for I. V. pain relief & antibiotics pending possible surgery. As it transpired, the I. V. drugs worked overnight and surgery was not required. I then moved to Ward 23B the next morning for continued I. V. antibiotics, before being discharged on the day after. I am now awaiting the tooth being removed by my local Dentist.  
The thoroughness and close attention from my G. P. (Dr Strachan), all staff in Oral and Maxillofacial, the nurses in Wards 7 & 23B, and the on duty Doctors and Consultants, was exemplary. They were all extremely conscientious, caring and very much patient focussed. Now that I am feeling much better, I am very grateful to everyone involved in my diagnosis and treatment. Also a thank you to the catering staff at Ninewells as I enjoyed all of the food during my stay. A heartfelt thank you to our National Health Service and the magnificent people who care for us and keep us safe and well at all times.

author: Juney66
title: Just a letter
body: I received a letter form Dr Siebert (The Royal hospital Glasgow, Rheumatology) with such informative details in it around what they had found, and what was being planned on how to deal with it and even what may have caused it that I felt compelled to comment. Not only was my mind put at ease because of the details with the letter but he had covered every angle that needed to be covered. Having this information written down really does make such a difference and I just appreciate this type of communication so much, possibly more so in the present climate. Thank you people like Dr Siebert, and my GP (Dr Thomson) for being so on the ball, it is very much appreciated

author: Aqualegias
title: Care  of my mum
body: My mum was admitted to Tye Green ward at Princess Alexandra Hospital in Harlow , with abdominal pains, in 2018.She developed C-diff infection and was isolated . She has bipolar disorder but was mentally ok at the start. As her carer, I can spot the early signs of mania and I warned the head nurse that I noticed she was changing mood and should be given her usual antipsychotic medication. Each day thereafter she was progressively a bit worse, and my mum was getting stressed from the C-diff infection, and as she has got good insight she told me she needed to see a Psychiatrist.. which was true.Every day thereafter, I asked nurses at the nursing station about the Psychiatrist and they said they would get one.On about day 4 from onset of bipolar symptoms, I asked a nurse to tell me what dose of medication was being dispensed. and the computer records showed the antipsychotic had been stopped completely...I could not believe it.Whenever I visited the nursing station to voice concerns about my mum, they would ignore me as if I was invisible unless I interrupted whatever they were doing. The junior doctor who was dealing with the physical diagnosis of ulcerative colitis seemed appalled at my mum's mental deterioration. An extremely good doctor and when I mentioned that mum was not swallowing the antibiotics, made sure the nurses watched my mum swallow the antibiotics. Finally I said to the nurse, where is the Psychiatrist? How many Psychiatrists are there? They said they didn't know. Soon after a CPN arrived and they said a Psychiatrist is available only on a particular (e.g. Tuesday) day of the week. In one week., my mum had gone from mentally sane to regressed to a baby. She was in the bed, naked from waist down, open door so any passing visitor could have seen her. Water was out of reach.When I arrived, she was extremely thirsty. She was so regressed she couldn't even hold the beaker to drink. The next day she was 50% better mentally because a Psychiatrist had visited her overnight. Luckily my mum responds very quickly to her antipsychotic medication and she soon recovered and did not need to be admitted to the Mental Health Unit nearby.Some of the nursing staff were good, but clearly not everyone. The junior doctor was particularly good.

title: Excellent group of Doctors.
body:
I have been with this practice for 32years. I have never had anything but excellent medical care. I count myself fortunate to be in the care of this group of doctores past and present.
Rate: the top. 20 out of 20. 
M Campbell 14.12.2020.

title: Not happy
body: Have now been waiting almost a week for my prescription to be approved.  All but one item has, no reason why the last item has not been approved, I have run out of meds, have not had for past 3 days and despite my phone calls and assurances that that prescription would be signed off I still find myself waiting.  I understand that COVID has changed the ways things are done now, but an explanation as to why the one item is still waiting for approval seems to be too much to ask.  Have been with this surgery for 50 years and have watched it go downhill rapidly in the past 3 - 4 years.  My anxiety is through the roof and god knows what damage is being done to me health wise due to the lack of meds.

title: Extremely rough staff on the appointments.
body: I'm experiencing long wait of 7 months for generating medical summary of my mother health stage. To get the first appointments for examinations like x-ray, scans and etc take 5 months. After receiving the results whatever I tried to book appointments to discuss the results with the doctor the staff on the phone it was very rough. Now 2 months every time I call them  they always have the answer that is not available any appointments. I'm wandering true NHS first someone needs to die to be written probably Covid19 just because is pandemic. Of course is dieing people, but the most of them because is not getting any response from the Health system and NHS. It unbelievable and completely unacceptable in UK at 2020.

title: Breath of Fresh Air
body: Not a patient at this practice but visited for one of their services. The receptionist was exceptional. She was working on her own with people firing questions at her, phones going, etc. yet sher remained calm, efficient, polite and friendly. 5* service!

title: Must be the worst surgery in the country!
body: Receptionist are rude and patronising. I have had to book a few appointments in the last few months after having not really used the surgery for the last 10 years. Everytime i ring to book there is a wait and you can only book at 8am. They never have any appointments available online. The receptionist are so rude, if you don‚Äôt like your job then get another but don‚Äôt let down your whole surgery because the doctors do a great job.

title: Very caring
body: Wow. I was asked to leave a review and I am more than happy to.  I received a call from the surgery manager to check if i had been to a very important appontment. It is such sweet to know there are people in this world who want to really check up and we had a lovely chat. Thank you

author: LindaGcareopinion
title: Physio in a Nursing Home
body: I had a visit at the Nursing Home where I live to assess my current mobility and to support me in improving my mobility.

title: Excellent care excellent staff
body: The care I received was of such a high standard I was extremely impressed. All the questions I asked were answered effectively and in a way I could understand. I just was treated with respect and dignity at all times. Nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely recommend their service to everyone

title: Great practice
body: It was efficient, professional, compassionate and I was well informed throughout the process. Booking process was easy and I‚Äôve been treated with tremendous courtesy by all the staff.

title: Patience for patients
body:
understanding on all fronts 
service still continues to be first class in every aspect 
support your local GP

title: Getting better
body: Have had some bad experience with trying to get see a GP but have noticed  improvement just a small comment  doctors are good but reception need to have alittle  more understanding it's not pleasant having to explain why you need a doctor  especially when it's in personal  area and being asked  to send a picture  .

author: AngeB
title: Let down by the care of my suicidal husband.
body:
How do I feel? Let down. Abandoned. Devastated. Angry. Rejected. Heartbroken.  
My husband's mental health gradually deteriorated since having a brain tumour removed twenty years ago. For the first few years, only close family and freinds would have noticed the new behaviour: self-doubt and quick temper. Over the years his mental health steadily grew worse with symptoms like verbal anger (never physical) depression, anxiety, restlessness, paranoia, suspicions, pushing friends away and self-hatred. We've recently discovered that these are possible side effects from left temporal lobe surgery, but we never made the corrolation between his neurosurgery and declining moods because we'd never been informed to look out for them.  
I've written a longer history to the coroner, but very simply this year, having lost the ability to work, feel positive, believe in himself or even like himself, his mind grew sicker. He couldn't understand why I would want to stay married to him when he was such a loser. (His words) I told him I loved him and the real person was in there, but just needed help. By now he was taking three different antidepressants. In the latter weeks we were paying for a phychologist to speak to him at ¬£150 a session. Due to his health, we had lost any equity and were now renting while on Universal Credit, so this payment to talk to someone was a huge percentage of our income. We knew he didn't have the strength to wait months until an NHS mental health professional would be available.  
His first cry for help was when he disappeared in his van with only a blanket and ALL his medication in October. I called the police. They arrived and were amazing. My daughter and son-in-law are also police officers and knew that the triage car would be called. The police requested them when they'd talked him back home, but the mental health team refused to visit. I would like to know how they choose between one person's life and another's. I'd like to know who makes that life and death decision. I'd like to know who said, No.  
His second cry for help was when he drove to Belvoir Castle with clear suicide intention. I called him but he wouldn't tell me where he was and wouldn't let me meet him. I called the police, who once again were there when we needed them. He was talked into going to our son's house in an area of Nottingham, which he eventually did. The triage car with the mental health team was requested for a second time. Once again, someone said, No. Do you have records that let you know this is a sick man who wanted to take his life for a second time? The police gave him a lot of time that evening and told him that someone from the mental health team would call him. As the hours passed, he was settled in bed at our son's house. The next morning he said he had received a phone call waking him in the early hours by someone from mental health team. They asked him if he needed to go to hospital, he had been woken up and said he was in bed at his son's. Whoever spoke to him said (as he recalled)-Okay then, in that case you won't need to speak to a psychiatric nurse. Goodbye.  
Who made that call? Who thought it was a good idea to ask a suicidal man whether he needed hospitalisation? Where were you?  
I found my beautiful husband, father to our three children and grandfather to twin six-year-old grandaughters after he committed suicide in a traumatic way.  
Where were you?

title: Great practice
body: Everyone is very helpful. They are able to sort everything out on time and staff is friendly on phone and in person.

title: Fantastic practice
body: Every area of this practice is just beyond perfect.  From reception nurse and Doctors which as a patient we could not ask for more.  Long may this excellent practice continue.

title: Delays
body:
Really bad experience during the COVID-19 situation - one when trying to get an appointment, it took 10 days to get a lump investigated and on the second occasion trying to get a prescription after having an operation. 
Reception staff seem unable at times to get hold of doctors or practice managers  and get ‚Äòstressed‚Äô when asked to provide assistance

title: The worst
body: It is impossible to get a appointment. End of. They just tell you to call 111. Probably the worst doctor surgery available.

title: Safe and confident
body:
Attended for Bronchoscopy. COVID precautions well in evidence in all areas. Quite a long wait from admission ,but department seemed very busy. When my time arrived,my apprehension increased. However the nurses who collected me were very friendly and escorted me to the procedure room and settled me in.
There were five medical staff present to whom I was introduced.
After all necessary checks were made I felt safe knowing they were prepared for any eventuality. After a hiccup with a faulty cannula, things were finally underway.  I cannot really recommend the banana anaesthetic spray, but it had to be done! My thanks to the lovely nurse who mopped up my tears! I managed to relax a bit with the help of sedation, and it was all over in 10 minutes! 
During the procedure I was constantly reassured and made as comfortable as possible.
I had complete confidence in all the team and made a quick recovery.
Many thanks for all your hard work and professionalism in what must be a terrible time to be on the front- line.
Sue Edwards

readBy.name: University Hospitals Dorset NHS Foundation Trust

title: Rubbish communication
body: ASK MY GP is always turned off, ridiculous waiting times on the phone to then have the phone put down on you when you finally get through to someone (after waiting 30 mins). Some staff are friendly but most lack knowledge and come across rude as if you rining the practice has caused them inconvenience.

title: Amazing care
body: The staff at the surgery go above and beyond in term of care that they provide. Having been with the surgery for 10 years this is not the first positive experience there are many.

title: Great doctors and nurses.
body: My mum had a gastroscopy done at Lady Sobell Unit, this was hers third visit. All this times she was treated with the best care and support even she was feeling stressed about all the procedure. All staff at this Unit is very supportive and great!

author: Dogzdream
title: Zero to hero
body: I was having such a hard time at work that it was getting me so down I was in a bad state, I have been helped by Kelly to work on my skills and now I have a lovely looking CV, im studying an admin course and I will be starting a new job shortly, thank you Kelly, your amazing.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Such Wonderful Care!
body:
I attended the minor injuries unit with my 2 year old daughter. I always knew that the day would come where I would have to take her to hospital for an injury but I was sincerely hoping that I would not have to do this under the current circumstance - unfortunately this was not the case! 
I felt extremely anxious about attending alone with her and was worried that I wouldnt be able to process all the information that the HCP gave me - but they were truly fabulous. All the nurses that we came into contact with were extremely empathetic to how I felt, took their time to explain everything that was happening, were all absolutely incredible with my daughter, and just all round put us both at ease. 
Under the current circumstance, things must be so stressful but it truly felt that the staff were going out of their way to look after us. 
We're all so extremely grateful for the amazing, and compassionate care that you showed us.

title: Closed-door policy continues
body: This surgery needs to learn the meaning of health care and understanding of patient needs. To simply hand-out telephone appointments is totally unacceptable. Everywhere else has Covid-19 proof systems where face to face appointments can be carried out. You can shop in supermarkets with lots of people but you can't get to see a Dr in person. They still make it so difficult to see anyone and are becoming an embaressment to the town. A lot of people are complaining - shame it's not to the right people. Come on Practice Manager, wake up and see that people come first, not just the well-being of your own staff hiding behind their doors.

title: Wonderful staff and services
body:
I have recently transferred to Homerton Hospital for my Chron's disease and have been absolutely blown away by the efficiency, top quality communication and overall kindness and care of every member of staff I have encountered. In the last 6 weeks I have visited for multiple appointments across the hospital, including:
- Gastroenterology check ups
- MRI
- Covid test
- Colonoscopy
- X-ray
- Blood tests
- TB test

Each time I have received a letter, text and sometimes a call confirming I would be coming in.

Every single department was smoothly run, even during COVID, the appointments were on time (or near enough), the staff were all friendly, kind and seemed to genuinely care. Having had a really awful experiences in other London hospitals with the ongoing care for my Chron's disease, sometimes not being seen for over a year due to appointment cancellations etc, Homerton Hospital has truly restored my faith in the NHS. 

Thank you so much to every member of staff there, your work is so appreciated and you have made a world of difference to me.

title: Very efficient
body:
I called at 8am to request an appointment for my daughter, within minutes the call was answered and I was given a telephone appointment. An hour later I was called by a physician‚Äôs associate who felt it necessary for my daughter to be examined and therefore organised a face to face appointment with a GP later that morning at 11:15am. 
A brilliantly efficient service provided by Langley Health Centre - thank you!

author: Eldon20
title: Patient experience
body:
Last Thursday I had a bad accident at home. Being an NHS employee I already know how much the NHS rocks, despite the pandemic, despite nurses, doctors, ancillary staff all being exhausted, the treatment and care I was given was truly outstanding.  
To Ronnie, Richard, Elaine and Erin the amazing paramedic and ambulance crew to the GRI Ed resus team who looked after me, Drs Jen and Leah, nurses Morag and Marie, to ward 61 ortho staff- SCN Marie Alan, Louise, Ashton, Rebecca Baz, Elaine, Fiona Stephanie and Aimee, to the theatre team Drs shebaz, Alex, Rebecca, Alisdair and Mr Gupta theatre and recovery nurses Tracy, David and Reeva your care and compassion was amazing. I was truly terrified and you made me feel so much better with your chat and reassurance. To the ward domestics and the porters who made me giggle and to the physios. You truly are an outstanding, resilient bunch of people and I am so immensely proud to be part of the nhs family with you all.

author: A_R_R
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: They've always been brilliant with me
body: See the way I see it they've always been brilliant with me when I find it hard to trust, especially when talking about my addiction so I will always be honest with them! I treat people how they treat me also you have to give respect to gain it. Thank you Candi - you're a star.

author: betagh83
title: Very valuable support
body:
I was referred to CMP by my workcoach at the jobcentre. I have been attending weekly online courses via zoom, followed up by telephone calls and resources via post. This has included very valuable help on mental, health, depression, healthy lifestyle and back pain also relaxation. The support has been provided by and occupational therapist, a mental health nurse and a physiotherapist.  
I would recommend this course to anyone with mild/moderate depression.  
It has certainly provided me with some very valuable support in understanding my condition and the 'follow up' via telephone calls and 'homework' is first class. It is not a cure for bad mental health and depression but can help tackle issues and follow up with other services in the local community for ongoing support. I will be sad when it finishes. The team have been amazing.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: liberatornx96
title: All their help and guidance
body:
I started with the conditional management program in Derry, from February, it was postponed due to covid - 19 but they contacted me once able and I've now finished the programme.  
My person (Caroline) was excellent in setting up sessions and giving me things to do and think about to help with my anxiety and stress. It was also great just to have someone in contact with me every week and helped with motivation. I would like to thank the team for all their help and guidance.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Terrible experience
body: My mother was ill in January and was prescribed antibiotics, her condition then worsened significantly and she went back to see a doctor who immediately called an ambulance.  In hospital they stopped the antibiotics she had been prescribed and gave her another type, she slowly started to regain her strength. She had a UTI 2 weeks ago and a doctor represcribed her the same antibiotics she was given in January.  Again she had a severe reaction AF, high fever, sick, unable to walk.  I am appalled that we as a family had to work out that my mother is allergic to that particular type of antibiotics prescribed and had the Dr looked properly through her notes they surely would have discovered this.  My mother was in a terrible state and it was only through stopping taking the antibiotics she started to improve.  I have spoken to the health centre 3 times on her behalf as my mother says she could never get through.  There is a high density of elderly patients who need to use the surgery who don‚Äôt have access to the internet and who can only access the surgery by phone.  Every time I phoned I was waiting for a minimum of 20 minutes to get through to someone.  I can cope with this as I am persistent and determined!  But an elderly person may just give up, when they really need to see a doctor, this absolutely unacceptable.

title: Impossible to make an appointment
body: Almost impossible to make an appointment. When we finally got in touch with someone to book a telephone apt, nobody called. No explanation of why or what to do next. Back to square one, 4 weeks wasted waiting whilst suffering and worried. It's no wonder people are dying.

title: No care
body: Awful admin systems. The clinical staff are good but the admin systems are unfit for purpose and actually seem designed to frustrate patients rather than help. I would NOT recommend this practice.

title: A disappointment
body: I requested a telephone call back from a doctor regarding myself. I know they are busy but it took a while to get back to me and eventually when the doctor rang me back I was told I had too many questions.. which was so rude! I've never had any complaints with any doctors before! And she didn't seem to really care and talk about being rushed the whole phone call it was pointless and after it all made me so upset I didn't get the response I needed and she told me she didn't have too much time and  was very rushy with me I really need this resolving because that isn't the way you talk to a patient or anyone. Very disappointed being a new patient of this surgery. Not very happy at all.

title: Over 8 hours left in A&E
body: Absolutely disgusted my 78 year old father was taken to A&E at 2pm it is now 10.20pm and still no one has come to see him since initial tests were done at 4pm - would you be happy with that on a Monday? Disgraceful it appears he has been forgotten?

title: Awful Care with Distributing Important‚Ä¶
body: I was a student and on antidepressants. In March they refused to continue to distribute my medication until I had a pill review. I left the number to call several times and they kept calling my old number and saying it hadn‚Äôt updated. This was all going on in my final year and around the time of my dissertation. Weeks went by and no one called me on the correct number and when I was assured multiple times someone would call me still no one did (they wouldn‚Äôt let me call them at a set time either). It took for me to have a breakdown over the phone To the receptionist for them to call me the next day (having waited all of that day for them to call me and still no one did). However the damage had been done. I went for many many weeks without my antidepressants during the most stressful time of my life. They did not handle it well and were not at all apologetic and didn‚Äôt even have a proper answer when I asked why they couldn‚Äôt send my prescription before I have the pill review. It has been 9 months since this occurred and I still have nightmares from my experience with them. I cannot put it into words how awful I felt and as a surgery who are supposed to help people in my experience they made me far worse. It went on for far too long and my mental condition dramatically deteriorated because of their refusal to send my prescription without speaking to me. A prescription which hadn‚Äôt even changed so there was no need for the review in the first place.

title: Currently feel unable to trust anything I've been‚Ä¶
body: My relative is an orthopaedic inpatient. We had been told they were progressing well, walking etc. The relatives line are helpful - though clearly can only read what has been documented in the notes. Today I learnt that all the physio entries we had been told about had been documented in the incorrect patients notes - and I was only told when I double checked against what I thought I knew. Duty of candour - nil. accurate record keeping seems to have failed. The person I spoke to today was very apologetic - but had phoned to essentially try to move relative out of hospital. I cannot visit my relative, I no longer feel I can trust the notes. The nurses have been notable for lack of communication eg no call to say relative out of theatre, no call to say moved to a different ward. We have had previous bad experiences in HRI and CRH. I am now really worried for my relative and based on previous experiences - terrified they will not be getting all the care they need other than basics.

readBy.name: Calderdale and Huddersfield NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
As an ex care home manager myself I was very choosy when finding a home for our Mom. I didn‚Äôt need to worry, the manager and staff at Inglewood are first class, caring, professional, thoughtful and considerate. They have helped my mum settle in so well in such trying times, they can‚Äôt do enough for her. The communication we have with them is excellent keeping us informed on all aspects of moms care.  They have been excellent in keeping all the residents safe and protected from Covid, which I know isn‚Äôt easy. The staff work so hard to make the lives of all the residents not just our mom a little bit better under sometimes very difficult circumstances. 
We can‚Äôt thank them enough

title: Extremely poor service
body: Unprofessional & extremely poor service standards from admin/ receptionist staff to GPs. Cannot get appointment despite hours wait on phone. Appointments policy is simply carries no sense. GPS reluctant to refer in deserving case until issues becomes too serious. Inadequate diagnosis and treatment

title: Totally professional and genuine care
body:
Yesterday I visited the practice to register a very close relative, due to a potentially life threatening condition. I was politely told that the person I needed to register, would have to come to the practice in person to register. 
This would have delayed urgent attention
which distressed me. This relative had gone through a lack of appropriate concern and attention in another setting and I was overcome with the helplessness I felt to get the right attention for my relative. I unexpectedly found myself unable to speak. Within seconds the receptionist was in tune with my distress. She immediately, calmly and
with compassion asked if I was okay and offered me a more private window in which to speak to her, away from the other patients in the waiting room, for which I was extremely grateful. 
On explaining the situation in more detail, the receptionist, who remained professional, sensitive and empathic throughout, immediately called the practice manager who also responded with understanding and patience. 
Within hours a doctor called me and a plan of action was put in place.
I cannot thank the receptionist enough for her compassion and astute professionalism, the practice manager for listening and understanding my predicament and for the doctor who acknowledged the seriousness of the situation. While, no doubt, everyone is under extreme pressure in light of covid, these members of the practice, today, are a credit to the practice and the profession. I felt understood. They gave me their time, with patience. I felt that they were genuinely concerned and that they cared. With gratitude and sincerity - Thank you.

title: Worst GP Practice i have ever been with
body:
I have been living in UK for the past 19yrs I have lived in various parts of UK and had great experience.
This practice is the worst i have ever been with you can never get someone to answer their phone to book appointment if you do you are told no appointment available. Since the pandemic i have not been able to book any appointment am class as highly valuable.
I receive texts to book for flu vaccine several attempts to book no luck no one answers the phone or the line just cuts off.
I am worried I hope someone reading this can make sure there is a total reform pls reflect in you practise and change. You are dealing with people's life.

title: Rude Nursing Staff
body:
Extremely rude nursing staff
Went with little one, after 4 hours of waiting, approached a nursing staff and politely asked - if the child will be seen
Was told in a loud voice‚ÄôHave you listened to your name? We are very busy‚Äô 

Felt really upset. She must have felt it was ok to be so condescending to some from ethnic minority background, 

I understood the wait but being polite goes a long way. 

Could overhear the staff grumble about patients, loudly arguing about breaks. Terrible

title: The worst time ever!
body: Was passed on by the gp to get a breast cyst drained. Was assigned to ward 20 and this is where things started going downhill. I know it's covid but staff are so unnattentive. Mind you there were only 6 of us on the ward. Saying this time and time again i was in no physical pain but i suffer from anxiety which is just as painful. I noticed both day and night staff not paying any attention to me. Would get sick of me if i kept pressing the buzzer. Yet without fail would regularly check on the other patients. Also had to wait for 14 hours before i had my procedure done which lasted only 10 mins! The after surgery care has just been as bad. Again no attention. Checked my wound and dressing once when i came back for recovery and left me all night and morning without checking on me. Asked for something warm like a hot drink to soothe my throat and got told they were busy. Nobody seems to know what job they are doing and whoever you ask always says it's not my job to do that. And the senior nurses/nurses in charge just don't even care.

readBy.name: Bradford Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Concern for critically extremely vulnerable .
body:
I have asthma, COPD and bronchiectasis, the latter in the lower part of the lungs. I am also 77 and classified as clinically extremely vulnerable. I had an appointment at 2 o'clock yesterday and arrived 10 minutes prior to this. It was a long and stressful walk for me to get to the department, owing to the above conditions, wearing a mask and almost pain in my back. I had followed government advice meticulously up till this point, not going  into shops, or, critically here, pharmacies. The reason for the latter presumably being that sick people go into pharmacies, and the same could be said of hospitals, but appointments are essential. I was therefore alarmed at the waiting time, as I could feel my breathing altering, particularly presumably because of the length of time wearing the mask.( Yes, I could have removed it , but people get anxious if I do, and particularly if I start to cough).  I had worn it in the car over, with windows open and my granddaughter driving also wearing one. This was followed by a (for me) longish walk. Then there was the long waiting time. At 3.o'clock (an hour after arrival) I had asked if there was a problem, and was told they had my name. By 3.10 my breathing was altering  for the worse, and I used the Ventolin I carry at all times. I informed a nurse of my difficulties and that I needed to get some air, and added that I was clinically extremely vulnerable. She told me that I should have informed reception of this, and they would have seen me sooner! I had been told to arrive a few minutes before the appointment time, and not told that I was to inform them of being critically extremely vulnerable. I pointed out that this was on my medical records, and was told that "we don't read those".I was feeling quite panicky and left, followed by said nurse asking if I was alright. Obviously not! Then I was called to and told to come back, as someone could see me. I am generally told not to talk when breathing is getting bad. I needed to get outside.
The reason I am writing this is that the critically extremely vulnerable should be told if they are to report this, and particularly if a long wait is envisaged. Also, surely the elderly should  be seen promptly, so they spend less time around other people in the present circumstances. There was only one other elderly person waiting, and he came in with a carer at around a quarter to 3. I have regular appointments with Ophthalmology and this situation has never arisen.  Would it also be possible to have the critically extremely vulnerable flagged up on the computer? In conclusion, I should add that my breathing was precarious for several hours after returning home, and now, the next day, I am coughing a lot.

title: Awful reception staff
body: After waiting what seems forever to get through you are met with the horrendous attitude and service of 1 of 2 staff members who I shall not name.I was given the absolute run around by both of them when I needed to speak to a qualified professional about my 9 month old daughters health. This left me super frustrated and inches away from whisking her to a and e to get some sort of care! Myself,I only ever call if I feel I have the energy to argue my case and even then its an uphill battle! I've been with the surgery for 6 years and these members of staff really let the place down. They act as if their pay will be cut for being remotely helpful or booking an appointment or showing just a slither of compassion.

title: Never answer the phone.
body: I have been ill for several days. I called up at 8am as advised by the receptionist. I have been trying for 37 minutes as it‚Äôs currently 8:37 and I have tried 349 times to get through! This is a joke. Why can they not have more phone lines on. Ridiculous

title: Efficient service
body: Good service  unfortunately the building did not inspire confidence.  I was immediately concerned just looking at the building.

title: You cannot book an appointment
body: I know we are all under a great pressure but to make me ring every day and tell me that I cannot book an appointment is disgraceful. To be honest I would prefer to pay for my care and being able to get some rather than working hard and pay for my care and not being able to get a simple appointment, which I was happy to have any time in the future.

title: Appalling, Avoid
body: We visited for our baby‚Äôs vaccinations. After having to call twice and being on hold for 30mins each time, we were told that the bookings had already been done for the month as they only have one nurse doing the vaccinations. As a result, our child has been behind on all of their vaccinations. Today, we arrived at the surgery to find it was shut due to water issues. We were not informed of this at any point, in fact receiving a text message the day before confirming the appointment. I now have to call another practice (20 mins on hold and counting) to try and understand what the situation is and when I can next get an appointment. Beyond frustrating to arrive to a shut practice, especially when it had been shut for 3 weeks prior. Now I will have a lot of admin and chasing to try and get this resolved through no fault of my own. I now go to a different practice and will be removing my child as soon as possible. Very poor service.

title: Receptionist to radiology extremely rude
body: This woman spoke to my husband in a very rude manner and obviously had not heard if the word 'please'. I stood behind him and stated please aloud as I was so cross with the way she treated him. A nearby nurse nodded at me and put her thumbs up, she obviously felt the same. The front receptionist was also very abrupt! Very bad way to treat patients and needs addressing!!

title: GP Appointment
body: Service is generally good, but in the past few years when I have asked to see or speak with my GP, I have been told that they are not in, there are no appointments left or to ring back on a specific day to make an appointment. I have done this and rung back on a specific day to make the appointment and asked for my GP but when I answered the phone for my appointment it was not my GP, it was a doctor I didn't know, despite the fact that I had asked specifically for my GP as they have better knowledge of my medical history.
